thread.title: Frozen out: the US interpreters abandoned on Europe’s border – video
thread.title_full: Frozen out: the US interpreters abandoned on Europe’s border – video

author: Max Duncan, Alice Aedy and Michael Tait
title: Frozen out: the US interpreters abandoned on Europe’s border – video
text:
US news Frozen out: the US interpreters abandoned on Europe’s border – video 
Jamshid and Mati served the US military as interpreters during the war in Afghanistan, but like many, but haven’t been granted visas to immigrate to the US. With their lives threatened by the Taliban, they joined the flood of migrants heading for western Europe, only to find themselves trapped in Serbia on the wrong side of impenetrable borders. They live in a squalid warehouse in central Belgrade, where more than 1,000 other migrants and refugees endure medieval conditions, sub-zero temperatures and toxic smoke. With smugglers refusing to take them across increasingly dangerous border crossings, all they can do is wait View more sharing options
